title: Level 3 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with angles, 3D objects, nets, maps and compass directions!

questions.question: What type of angle is less than a right angle ($90°$)?
questions.explanation: An **acute angle** is less than $90°$. Think of 'acute' as 'a cute little angle' -- it's small and sharp.

questions.question: How many faces does a cube have?
questions.explanation: A cube has **6 faces**, all of which are squares. Think of a dice -- it has 6 sides showing numbers 1 to 6.

questions.question: A net is made of 1 square and 4 triangles. What 3D object does it fold into?
questions.explanation: A square pyramid has a square base and 4 triangular faces. The 4 triangles fold up from the square to meet at a point at the top.

questions.question: You are facing South. You turn left. Which direction are you now facing?
questions.explanation: Facing South and turning left (anticlockwise) takes you to East. Going anticlockwise: S → E → N → W.

questions.question: A rectangular prism has how many edges?
questions.explanation: A rectangular prism has **12 edges**: 4 along the length, 4 along the width and 4 along the height. Check with Euler's rule: $6 + 8 - 12 = 2$ ✓

questions.question: On a clock face at 3 o'clock, what type of angle is between the hour hand and the minute hand?
questions.explanation: At 3 o'clock, the hands point to 12 and 3 -- that's exactly a quarter turn, which is a **right angle** ($90°$).

questions.question: How many vertices (corners) does a square pyramid have?
questions.explanation: A square pyramid has 4 vertices at the corners of the square base, plus 1 at the top (apex) = **5 vertices**.

questions.question: What direction is opposite to North-East?
questions.explanation: Opposite directions: N↔S, E↔W, NE↔SW, NW↔SE. The opposite of North-East is **South-West**.

questions.question: How many squares make up the net of a cube?
questions.explanation: A cube has 6 faces, all of which are squares. So its net is made of **6 squares**.

questions.question: An angle is greater than a right angle but less than a straight angle. What type of angle is it?
questions.explanation: An angle between $90°$ (right angle) and $180°$ (straight angle) is called an **obtuse angle**.
